newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK stocks set for jump but HK Telecom seen weaker.
newsitem.headline: HK stocks set for jump but HK Telecom seen weaker.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks are expected to push ahead on Tuesday, drawing strength from record highs on Wall Street, but Hongkong Telecom is set for profit-taking after its parent announced it would sell shares to China Telecom.

The Hong Kong market was closed on Monday for a public holiday but the Hong Kong London Reference Index of Hong Kong shares in London gained 215.63 points to 14,870.76 on Monday following a surge in U.S. share prices.
"The market is going higher but I think we are going to see some profit-taking around 15,000 points," said Alex Tang, head of research at Yamaichi International.
Peter So, deputy head of research at Schroder Securities, said profit-taking in Hongkong Telecom shares should cap the Hang Seng Index's rise.
"Today's rise will probably be kept within a 100 to 200 point range," he said.

Shares in Hongkong Telecom rose sharply last week ahead of an announcement late on Friday that Cable & Wireless would sell a 5.5 percent stake in Hongkong Telecom to the Chinese Ministry of Post and Telecommunications.
"People are likely to sell on the good news," said So.
